title: LOOKING FOR BRONZE CLIMBING TEAM

embed.description: Omega67679 / Bronze 5 73LP / 141W 194L Win Ratio 42% / Illaoi - 40W 63L Win Ratio 39%, Kayle - 23W 25L Win Ratio 48%, Zac - 11W 24L Win Ratio 31%, Renekton - 7W 8L Win Ratio 47%, Pantheon - 5W 7L Win Ratio 42%

body:
The link you will find takes you to my summoner OPP.GG.. im looking for a bronze team to accompany me to climb the ladder in flex 5v5 and have the team solo/duo q together, the reason being is i want to play better and actually climb the ranks, and also find some friends to play with and have a fun time, probable stream days and recording of game play will happen 
this will all be in 2018 but im looking forward to seeing some friendly players join me on some wild and ridiculous adventures in the coming season of League Of Legends

replies.body: You'll definitely find a lot more players in your ranked games, Team recruitment in the forums is little to no one. From past experiences on smurfing its fairly easy to find players that are willing to play, so I personally suggest adding people that you enjoy playing with in-game. In terms of getting better, I would suggest investing a little bit of time in researching, since there are plenty of resources out there to support you. But to keep it short from my perspective, follow a strict champion pool, follow pro players runes/masteries and build path. Climbing in bronze generally going to be hard but as long as you get better it shouldn't matter much. I would probably suggest playing meta champions and drop kayle or zed, since those champions is pretty mechanically hard. Like with Kayle you really gotta kite and probably control your wave. But step 1. find a easier champion 2. improve mechanically 3. knowledge is as important but you can improve on that right now or later on, as you can win from just playing smart and with less risk (Apdo). Since you're in bronze your learning curve can easily improve drastically.
You will never climb with 40% win rate. Start fresh with new account.
